p.4: =E2=80=A2 Design and implement bioinformatic analyses and support development of analysis pipeline for clinical submissions.
p.5: =E2=80=A2 Model and analyze large scale Next generation sequencing (NGS) data with rigorous bioinformatics and statistical approaches.
p.6: Annotate genetic data based on genetic database, such as COSMIC, and reference papers.
p.7: =E2=80=A2 Understand clinical trial objectives, design, endpoints and procedures defined in Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP) and perform end-to-end analysis from data QC to final delivery.
p.8: =E2=80=A2 Provide statistical programming and validation support to create analysis datasets, TLFs and relevant documentation as per the specifications within set timelines.
p.9: =E2=80=A2 Closely collaborate within Biomarker project and statistical team within the assigned scope of work
p.10: =E2=80=A2 Maintain relevant documentation for the programming and validation tasks within the assigned scope of work.
p.14: =E2=80=A2 Ph.D. or MSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Computational Biology, or related field with 5+ years of experience.
p.15: =E2=80=A2 Familiar with software development, cloud computing infrastructures and project management tools such as JIRA/Azure DevOps, Github, and Docker.
p.16: =E2=80=A2 Excellent knowledge of database and SAS/SQL/R/Python programming.
p.17: =E2=80=A2 Experiences in NGS read processing, variant calling, variant annotation, and analyzing large-scale genetic datasets.
p.18: Excellent knowledge of public genetic and genomic databases
